intro: Phlomoides tuvinica, commonly known as the Tuvinian bluemouth, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, lance-shaped leaves, and small, clustered blue or purple flowers. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
